noun.description: A circular object that revolves on an axle and is fixed below a vehicle or other object to enable it to move easily over the ground.
A machine or structure having a wheel as its essential part.
A thing resembling a wheel in form or function, in particular a cheese made in the form of a disk.
An instance of wheeling; a turn or rotation.

verb.description: Push or pull (a vehicle with wheels)
examples: the sled was wheeled out to the flight deck

verb.description: (of a bird or aircraft) fly in a wide circle or curve.

phrases: the money is inadequate to grease the wheels of recovery
Staveley's Rob Jebb became only the second athlete to win the Three Peaks on foot and on wheels at the weekend, writes Mike Addison.
Parents need to be more aware if their children are on wheels they should be wearing helmets, he said.
They arrive on wheels, travel through the hospital on wheels and may be prescribed medicine, which originates from plants and minerals.
origin: Old English hwÄ“ol (noun), of Germanic origin, from an Indo-European root shared by Sanskrit cakra wheel, circle and Greek kuklos circle.
